issues.description: The solution’s SealSaloon class defines a static method named receiveDelivery(String, int, int), but the problem statement (and its UML/tests) specify a method acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int). This name mismatch in the method signature will prevent students’ implementations (and the provided tests) from aligning with the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the static receiveDelivery method in SealSaloon to acceptSupplyDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity) so it matches the problem specification and tests.

issues.description: The problem statement and tests specify a method named ‘acceptSupplyDelivery’, but the solution implementation names this method ‘receiveDelivery’. This naming mismatch will confuse students mapping the requirement (acceptSupplyDelivery) to the provided solution (receiveDelivery).
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solution’s static method ‘receiveDelivery’ to ‘acceptSupplyDelivery’ (and update its usage) so it matches the problem statement and test expectations.
